title: (x) Prehm & Arendt square tech sans - Uberform {Angel (via Hanno)}
content:
Hi! Can anyone help with identifying this geometric font?  
thanks!

 [‹ (x) "Museum Photographs", similar to Garamond - TEFF Lexicon {Michael A}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142811/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36600 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Small Town DJs" constructed geometric face w/ soft edges - custom designed {Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142811/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36592 "Go to next forum topic")
author: yebastian

comments.content: There seems to be no image attached …

I’m not sure, but I believe this is a font by [bionic systems](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142811/http:/www.bionic-systems.com/), a design studio here in duesseldorf. I think they also did the corporate design for Prehm & Arendt and seem to use this font in various projects, e.g. the [open source festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142811/http:/www.open-source-festival.de/). I don’t know if this font is for sale.
Thanks for the data! I´m watching now and I believe that you are right.. regards!

Following on from Hanno, it’s called Überform and you can contact Malte Haust for a price.

[http://www.identifont.com/show?C11](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104142811/http:/www.identifont.com/show?C11 "http://www.identifont.com/show?C11")

It was listed in their 2004 catalogue at 129 euros.
Nope — I inadvertently miscredited the thread. It’s all yours, Angel. ;^)
OK. Thanks Yves. Although I do note that some posts don’t appear straight away... so I thought it was one of those!
